> 1) Has anyone else noticed that raise dead is grossly unfair?  Once 
> you get it as a cleric, stages become farcical, and your level sky-
> rockets.

That's why I view exp level 1-2 opponents as future team mates.

> 2) Is there any point to whirl and disasrm?  There is a 
> (questionable) value to boomerang, once you have a ton of MP, but 
> charge is clearly the best soldier ability.

I actually view soldiers as magic guzzlers because the amount of 
damage done compared to the amount of magic used is ridiculous.
 
> 3) Do resurrect and eat corpse even work?

Eat corpse supposedly works.  Resurrect works.
 
> 4) Are ghosts as ludicrously powerful in "army v. army" style play 
as 
> they are in "heroes v. army"?  As it currently stands, if a ghost 
> catches one of us in a corner, it's just escape, restart, because 
> there's no hope of ever getting unscared.  Seems foolish, so I can't 
> imagine it's that way if you play "properly."

Actually, the same solution exists to this problem as the problem of 
standing next to a bomb when it explodes.  Cycle through your 
teammates, because by the time you get back to yourself you're 
unfrozen.  With a one player team, cycling through undoes the effect 
immediately, most of the time.
 
> 5) Anyone noticed that if you lose a level, leave it, and come back 
> much later, it will be beaten?

Sometimes.
 
> 6) Why is Centweith Manor so difficult relative to every other level 
> in the game, when it's ostensibly a "side-quest" on your way to 
> killing Jakarta?  Am I missing something about how you're supposed 
to play it?

Hehe.  "Tic and Tac" is the hardest level by far in my book.  It's 
because the experience levels of those opponents are so high.
 
> 7) What exactly do the various stats do?  Especially dexterity, 
which 
> doesn't seem to change walking speed very much; the others have 
> their "obvious" effects -- more MP, more HP, less damage taken, more 
> damage inflicted -- but does intelligence effect spells?  Etc.

Intelligence effects amount of magic storied and how long it takes to 
recharge your magic power.  Byeond that, I don't know.
 
> 8) Why are elvish rock-throwing attacks so damned powerful in 
certain levels?

I've noticed that sometimes rocks can bounce around seeminglyt 
forever.
 
> ---
 
> Anyway, my larger questions are:
> 
> 1) Is Gladiator still being updated in any fashion?

At least now you can download a version of Gladiator:Beyond Freedom.  
visit http://groups.yahoo.com/group/gladiator/files/Alpa/ to download 
the files for that program.
 
> 2) Is there any way to patch the game to add new classes, or to make 
> the classes more interesting?  Right now, the Mage is really the 
only one who gets increasingly complex as you level up.

No.  We had a pretty good discussion a while back about adding new 
abilites to characters and expanding character classes.
 
> 3) Are there any GOOD fan-made scenarios?  I didn't like Tryx 
much...

Visit http://groups.yahoo.com/group/gladiator/files/Scenarios/ and try 
those out.  I would recommend to try the tevfifty first.  After that, 
try mine (dph's scenarios).

We're also working on getting a gladiator tournament ready.
